---

Below is a comprehensive **Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) Dictionary** for the "Requirements Gathering Agent" project, created following PMBOK guidelines. Each work package is organized with detailed attributes, including WBS code, name, description, responsible party, resources, estimated duration, acceptance criteria, dependencies, quality requirements, and assumptions/constraints.

## 1.0 Project Initiation  

### 1.1 Project Charter  

| **WBS Code**        | 1.1                                          |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Work Package Name**| Project Charter                             |
| **Description**      | Develop the project's formal authorization document and outline the high-level scope, objectives, and constraints. |
| **Responsible Party**| Project Manager (PM)                        |
| **Resources**        | Business Analysts, AI tools (GPT-4), PMBOK templates |
| **Estimated Duration**| 2 working days                             |
| **Acceptance Criteria**| Charter approved by all key stakeholders. |
| **Dependencies**     | Stakeholder Register (1.2)                  |
| **Quality Requirements**| Must include clear objectives, deliverables, and constraints. |
| **Assumptions/Constraints**| Stakeholders are available for approval within the planned timeline. |

---

### 1.2 Stakeholder Register  

| **WBS Code**        | 1.2                                          |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Work Package Name**| Stakeholder Register                        |
| **Description**      | Identify and document all project stakeholders, their roles, expectations, and influence levels. |
| **Responsible Party**| Business Analyst (BA)                       |
| **Resources**        | Stakeholder interviews, communication tools |
| **Estimated Duration**| 3 working days                             |
| **Acceptance Criteria**| Stakeholder register reviewed and signed off. |
| **Dependencies**     | Project Charter (1.1)                       |
| **Quality Requirements**| Must include stakeholder influence analysis. |
| **Assumptions/Constraints**| Stakeholders provide accurate and complete input during interviews. |

---

## 2.0 Project Planning  

### 2.1 Requirements Management Plan  

| **WBS Code**        | 2.1                                          |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Work Package Name**| Requirements Management Plan                |
| **Description**      | Develop a formal plan for collecting, analyzing, and managing requirements throughout the project lifecycle. |
| **Responsible Party**| Requirements Analyst                        |
| **Resources**        | PMBOK templates, AI tools (GPT-4), collaboration software |
| **Estimated Duration**| 4 working days                             |
| **Acceptance Criteria**| Plan approved by stakeholders and aligned with PMBOK standards. |
| **Dependencies**     | Stakeholder Register (1.2)                  |
| **Quality Requirements**| Must include traceability matrix for all requirements. |
| **Assumptions/Constraints**| All stakeholders are available for validation. |

---

### 2.2 Scope Management Plan  

| **WBS Code**        | 2.2                                          |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Work Package Name**| Scope Management Plan                       |
| **Description**      | Define how the project scope will be developed, validated, and controlled. |
| **Responsible Party**| Project Manager                             |
| **Resources**        | PMBOK templates, scope workshops, AI tools |
| **Estimated Duration**| 3 working days                             |
| **Acceptance Criteria**| Scope signed off by stakeholders.         |
| **Dependencies**     | Requirements Management Plan (2.1)          |
| **Quality Requirements**| Must include in-scope and out-of-scope items. |
| **Assumptions/Constraints**| Scope workshops occur without delays. |

---

### 2.3 Work Breakdown Structure (WBS)  

| **WBS Code**        | 2.3                                          |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Work Package Name**| Work Breakdown Structure (WBS)              |
| **Description**      | Develop the hierarchical decomposition of the project's deliverables. |
| **Responsible Party**| Project Manager                             |
| **Resources**        | PMBOK templates, AI tools, scope documents |
| **Estimated Duration**| 3 working days                             |
| **Acceptance Criteria**| WBS approved and aligned with project scope. |
| **Dependencies**     | Scope Management Plan (2.2)                 |
| **Quality Requirements**| Must ensure all deliverables are included and clearly defined. |
| **Assumptions/Constraints**| No significant changes to project scope during WBS development. |

---

### 2.4 WBS Dictionary  

| **WBS Code**        | 2.4                                          |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Work Package Name**| WBS Dictionary                              |
| **Description**      | Create detailed descriptions for each work package in the WBS. |
| **Responsible Party**| Project Manager                             |
| **Resources**        | PMBOK guidelines, AI tools, WBS             |
| **Estimated Duration**| 2 working days                             |
| **Acceptance Criteria**| Dictionary reviewed and signed off by stakeholders. |
| **Dependencies**     | Work Breakdown Structure (2.3)              |
| **Quality Requirements**| Must provide complete and accurate details for all work packages. |
| **Assumptions/Constraints**| Stakeholders are available to review the document. |

## 3.0 Execution and Development  

### 3.1 AI Provider Integration  

| **WBS Code**        | 3.1                                          |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Work Package Name**| AI Provider Integration                     |
| **Description**      | Integrate multiple AI providers (e.g., OpenAI, Google AI) into the system for document generation. |
| **Responsible Party**| Development Team                            |
| **Resources**        | API keys, AI tools, development platform    |
| **Estimated Duration**| 5 working days                             |
| **Acceptance Criteria**| Successful integration and testing of all supported AI providers. |
| **Dependencies**     | Context Manager Implementation (3.2)        |
| **Quality Requirements**| Must include error handling and fallback mechanisms. |
| **Assumptions/Constraints**| AI provider APIs are stable and accessible. |

---

### 3.2 Context Manager Implementation  

| **WBS Code**        | 3.2                                          |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Work Package Name**| Context Manager Implementation              |
| **Description**      | Develop the system responsible for managing project context and AI interactions. |
| **Responsible Party**| Development Team                            |
| **Resources**        | TypeScript, Node.js, testing framework      |
| **Estimated Duration**| 7 working days                             |
| **Acceptance Criteria**| Context manager operates without errors and optimizes context for AI utilization. |
| **Dependencies**     | AI Provider Integration (3.1)               |
| **Quality Requirements**| Must support large context models (e.g., Gemini 1.5 Pro). |
| **Assumptions/Constraints**| No major changes to project requirements during development. |

---

### 3.3 Document Generation Engine  

| **WBS Code**        | 3.3                                          |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Work Package Name**| Document Generation Engine                  |
| **Description**      | Build the engine responsible for generating PMBOK-compliant documents from project inputs. |
| **Responsible Party**| Development Team                            |
| **Resources**        | AI tools, PMBOK templates, testing framework |
| **Estimated Duration**| 10 working days                            |
| **Acceptance Criteria**| Documents generated meet PMBOK standards and pass validation. |
| **Dependencies**     | Context Manager Implementation (3.2)        |
| **Quality Requirements**| Must include schema validation for all outputs. |
| **Assumptions/Constraints**| AI models are capable of generating high-quality outputs. |
